business.headline: Modi vs Modi: The succession war brewing at Godfrey PhillipsAs the legal showdown unfolds, it's Modi vs Modi in a gripping battle that tests family bonds and determines the future of Godfrey Phillips India, highlighting ambition, legacy, and loyalty.

Meet Alakh Pandey, the young Edtech visionary behind Physics WallahFrom a humble tutor to a trailblazing entrepreneur, Alakh Pandey's journey with Physics Wallah shows how passion and perseverance can turn even the simplest beginnings into a $2.8 billion empire—reshaping education, one formula at a time.
Akriti Chopra, Zomato co-founder and Chief People's Officer, resignsIn an email to Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal, Akriti Chopra announced her decision to resign with immediate effect.
Explained: Why SJVN shares gained over 6% todayThe stock rose 6.03% to Rs 133.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with a market capitalisation of Rs 52,520 crore.
Sensex, Nifty end lower after hitting record highs as financial stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 264.27 points lower at 85,571.85, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 37.10 points lower at 26,178.95.

Swiggy files for Rs 10,000 crore IPO: Here's all you need to knowSwiggy's IPO will consist of two main parts: a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 3,750 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 18.52 crore shares by existing stakeholders.

India once had a Rs 10,000 note. Know why it was discontinuedThe history of India's Rs 10,000 note dates back to the pre-independence era. In 1938, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) issued its first Rs 10,000 note, the largest denomination ever printed in the country.
What are multi-asset funds and are they good for your investment portfolio?Multi-asset funds are schemes that invest in a combination of three or more assets, such as equities, bonds, and gold.
China boosts exports: Will it hurt India, other global markets?With a slowing domestic economy, China is looking to global markets to absorb its excess production.

Real estate multibagger stock soars 260% in 1 year since IPO. Have you invested?Since its debut on the stock exchanges on September 27, 2023, the stock has outperformed not only its peers but also the broader real estate market.
Swipe, spend, struggle: How credit card defaults are spiking in IndiaOnce a symbol of freedom, credit cards now trap young Indians in growing debt. Could defaults be the new norm?

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status, other detailsKRN Heat Exchanger opened for subscription on September 25 looking to raise Rs 341.95 crore from its public issue, and has already seen bids of over 80 times.

Accenture guidance boost lifts Infosys, Wipro; IT stocks rally up to 4%Accenture not only exceeded market expectations for its Q4 results but also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to a range of 3-6%.

Isha, Akash Ambani among top young entrepreneurs in Hurun's under-35 listThe Hurun list celebrates 150 entrepreneurs aged 35 or younger from across India, marking their achievements in fields ranging from retail to tech startups.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high for 6th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex added 67.47 points to 85,903.59, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.70 points to 26,230.75.

Swiggy files for IPO, aims to raise about Rs 3,750 croreSwiggy, backed by investment group Prosus and Japan's SoftBank, competes with Zomato in India's online restaurant and cafe food deliveries sector.

Will Middle East conflict dampen Dalal Street's rally? Here's what experts say Despite the uncertainty arising from the Middle East conflict, Indian stocks have surged, with benchmarks like the Sensex and Nifty showing strong gains.

Vedanta shares cross Rs 500 mark after gaining 5%. More gains ahead?Vedanta's performance in 2024 has been impressive, with the stock climbing 95% so far this year and gaining 124.35% over the last 12 months. Over a five-year period, the stock has risen by 202%.
Sensex, Nifty close at all-time high led by rally in auto and metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 666.25 points to end at 85,836.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 211.90 points to close at 26,216.05.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 4 killed in Israeli strike on building in Beirut, 1st attack inside city limits Live UpdatesAs Israel continued to strike Lebanon, the Health Ministry in Beirut claimed that at least 105 people were killed in the attacks in the past 24 hours.

Israel turns heat on Houthis in Yemen after crippling Hezbollah, 4 deadIsraeli forces have launched aggressive aerial assaults on the Iran-backed militias in the region, including Hezbollah in Lebanon and Houthis in Yemen.

India could have outmatched IMF funds to Pak if ties were better: Rajnath SinghDefence Minister Rajnath Singh accused Pakistan of 'seeking money from other countries to run a terrorist factory on its soil', while the country faces one of the worst economic crises.

Demolition at Kolkata hospital days after doctor's rape, document reveals whyA total of eight people signed the document. Following that, hospital authorities started renovating the area in front of the seminar hall.

SpaceX Crew-9, Sunita Williams' new ride home, arrives at space stationNasa's decision to switch Williams and Wilmore to SpaceX has extended their mission on the ISS by several months. Originally scheduled to return after an eight-day mission, they will now remain on the station until late February.

Noted industrialist SP Oswal duped of Rs 7 crore by cyber criminals, 2 arrestedA complaint was filed by the Vardhman Group alleging that their CMD SP Oswal was duped by unidentified cyber criminals for Rs 7 crore. Two people were arrested by the Ludhiana Police in connection with the case and efforts are being made to arrest seven other members of the gang.

Varun Chakravarthy earns second chance to prove his worth for IndiaIndia vs Bangladesh: Varun Chakravarthy has made a remarkable return to the Indian T20I team for the series against Bangladesh. The 33-year-old mystery spinner's journey back into the squad is a story of perseverance and determination.

170 dead in Nepal floods, search ops on for 42 missing peopleNepal Floods News: As many as 4,000 people affected by flood-related incidents have been rescued and relief material has been provided. National highways in Nepal have been blocked since Saturday, with several people trapped due to landslides.

In pics: Buildings sunken to ground at site of Nasrallah's killing in BeirutTwo days after the attack in which Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was assassinated, devastation was witnessed at the site and people were seen offering prayers and paying their respects to Nasrallah.

BJP expels 8 Haryana leaders for six years over choosing to contest independentlyRanjit Singh Chautala decided to quit the saffron party after he was denied the poll ticket from Rania, the seat he represented in the Assembly when he was an independent MLA.

Ground Report: How money is exchanged at Lebanon-Syria border: Ashraf WaniAfter violence between Hezbollah and Israel escalated, tens of thousands of people from war-torn Lebanon crossed the border to arrive in Syria. There is an interesting banking system at the Lebanese-Syrian border, India Today's Ashraf Wani explained.

Ajit Doval to visit France today, Rafale deal among key agendas: SourcesThis meeting comes soon after France submitted the final detailed offer for the Rafale deal in the negotiations held in New Delhi, sources told India Today.

Ranveer Singh brims with joy at event, tells paps 'baap ban gaya re'Ranveer Singh made his first appearance after becoming a father at an Ambani-hosted event. He expressed his joy by telling the paparazzi, 'baap ban gaya re'.

Jamaat-backed candidate in J&K campaigns with GPS tracker on ankleSikandar Malik, who was arrested in connection with the UAPA case against the banned Jamaat-e-Islami by the National Investigation Agency, is currently out on bail and has been wearing the GPS tracker since the past four months.

Amit Shah asked BJP leaders to split Opposition: Uddhav Thackeray's big chargeUddhav Thackeray said that during his recent visit to Nagpur, Amit Shah held a closed-door meeting of BJP leaders where he asked them to split the Opposition ranks and politically stop him and Sharad Pawar.

T20 World Cup: Jemimah, Vastrakar star as India beat West Indies in warm-upsThe Indian team started off their warm-up fixtures with an emphatic 20-run win over West Indies in Dubai. Jemimah Rodrigues scored 52 and Pooja Vastrakar took 3 wickets to help India win.

Theft of donations at Bengaluru temple caught on camera, sparks outrageSeveral videos of individuals stealing donations during the counting process at a Bengaluru temple, which went viral, have sparked outrage, prompting a police investigation.

Protest erupts in Kerala hospital after 3-hour power outage, probe orderedAfter complaints of a power outage in Thiruvananthapuram's Sree Avittam Thirunal Hospital (SAT) Hospital, Kerala's Health Minister Veena George said a comprehensive technical committee would carry out a probe into the power outage reported in one of the blocks in the hospital.

Ground Report: Beirut roads remain empty as Israel continues to pound LebanonA normally bustling South Beirut roads turned quiet and deserted amid the firing of missiles and devastating airstrikes between Israel and Lebanon.
Kia Sonet Diesel AT: Should you buy it?The Kia Sonet is one of the largest-selling compact SUVs in India. It has a diesel engine with AT. Should you go for it? Read and find out.

PM Modi speaks to Mallikarjun Kharge after Congress chief falls ill during rallyAddressing a public rally in Kathua, Mallikarjun Kharge felt dizzy and was helped into a chair by his colleagues on stage. Later in the day, PM Modi spoke to the Congress President to enquire about his health.

Police deny reports of probing 'occult practices' angle in Vasant Kunj deathsEarlier, a report by news agency PTI claimed that the police will study the 2018 Burari suicide case to probe any "occult practice" angle in the Vasant Kunj deaths.

Politician who fought UP polls in 2022 turns out to be member of car theft gangA gang of six people accused of being involved in luxury car thefts in Delhi, were arrested. Amongst them is Mohammad Anas, who contested Assembly elections from UP's Kithore on Aazad Samaj Party's ticket in 2022.

Inside Priyanka Chopra's perfect Sunday with daughter Malti MariePriyanka Chopra spent a cosy Sunday with her daughter Malti Marie. She shared an adorable picture of herself with Malti. The actor is currently shooting for the second season of Citadel.

SS Rajamouli, Ram Charan's shout-out for Alia Bhatt's Jigra Telugu trailerFilmmaker SS Rajamouli and actor Ram Charan praised Alia Bhatt's Jigra Telugu trailer, highlighting its emotional depth and intense storyline. The film releases on October 11.

Devara box office Day 3: Jr NTR film mints Rs 250 crore globallyJr NTR and director Koratala Siva's Devara: Part 1 grossed Rs 250 crore worldwide. The film had an eventful opening weekend in theatres.

sports.headline: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag unconcerned about future after Spurs lossManchester United boss Erik ten Hag said that he isn't thinking about his future at the club despite their recent loss to Tottenham Hotspur on September 29, Sunday.

Real Madrid manager Ancelotti disappointed after 1-1 derby draw at AtleticoReal Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti was frustrated after his team let hosts Atletico Madrid salvage a 1-1 draw with a goal late into extra time in their LaLiga match on Sunday.

Pressure rises on Erik Ten Hag as Tottenham romp Manchester United 3-0Tottenham beat Manchester United 3-0 and climbed to eighth in the table on 10 points after six games. On the other hand United are 12th with seven points that will again raise questions about manager Erik ten Hag.

IND vs BAN 2nd Test Kanpur Weather Report: Is Play possible on Day 4?The Days 2 and 3 of the ongoing second Test between India and Bangladesh were washed out due to rain and wet outfield leaving fans wondering whether they will get to see some action on Day 4.

Litchfield, Harris miss warm-ups as Australia face injury scare  Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Australia have had a couple of injury scares after Grace Harris and Phoebe Litchfield missed both their warm-up matches.

Happy Birthday Richu: Indian women's team celebrate ahead of T20 World CupThe Indian team celebrated Richa Ghosh's 21st birthday as she was smeared with cake, followed by a little tea party. Harmanpreet Kaur-led side will begin their campaign from October 4.

Bangladesh name squad for India T20Is, Mehidy Hasan recalledIND vs BAN: Bangladesh have recalled Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Rakibul Hasan and Parvez Hossain Emon for their three-match T20I series against India. Shoriful Islam has also returned after recovering from a groin injury.

BCCI holds 93rd annual general meet: Here are key takeaways The BCCI's AGM highlighted important steps for Indian cricket, focusing on good governance and financial planning. With new members in the IPL Governing Council and key decisions on player auctions, the future of cricket in India looks bright.

Ajay Jadeja highlights MS Dhoni's special trait: 'He doesn't desire to be no 1 or 2'Former India cricketer Ajay Jadeja named his four possible retentions for five-time IPL champions CSK ahead of the mega auction for the 2025 season. Jadeja also highlighted Dhoni's special trait.

Varun rewarded for hard work on tough pitches in IPL: Parthiv Patel IND vs BAN: Parthiv Patel said that Varun Chakravarthy found his place back into the Indian T20I team after his impressive performances for KKR on tough pitches to bowl at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Musheer Khan thanks BCCI, fans in emotional video after road accidentMusheer Khan and his father Naushad thanked the fans and the BCCI after they were involved in a car accident. Musheer suffered a neck fracture and will remain out of action for at least three months.

PCB warns centrally contracted players: Improve fitness or face termination	The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has initiated a firm directive aimed at improving the fitness levels of their centrally contracted players. In a recent meeting, PCB officials have explicitly warned 6 to 7 players that maintaining poor fitness standards could jeopardise their contracts.

Watch: Tilak Varma's fun slide ride with Rohit Sharma's daughter SamairaTilak Varma and Rohit Sharma's daughter Samaira share a great bond between them. Ritika Sajdeh shared an Instagram story of the two as they took a fun slide.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
